intro: Wulfenia blechicii var. lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf wulfenia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant has slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in full sun. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical study.
